Ammo.label: Ammo / Penetration
Ammo.template:
Search: REQUIRED. Prefer escapefromtarkov.fandom.com/wiki (Ammunition).

RULES:
- The ammo name shown in the image is ALWAYS correct.
- If the caliber cannot be read from the screenshot, infer the most likely calibers using ammo name + box color + tip color.
- If uncertain, output **two full ammo profiles**:
  1) "First guess" (most likely caliber)
  2) "Second guess" (next most likely caliber)
- Each profile must use the REAL stats of that caliber — do NOT reuse stats from the first profile.
- Never invent ammo or calibers.

Output (when 100% sure):
**Ammo:** <Exact name>
**Caliber:** <Caliber>

MapLocation.label: Map / Location / Extract
MapLocation.template:
Use the screenshot to identify the Escape From Tarkov map, rough position, and give a simple route to a nearby extract.
Search: ALLOWED. Prefer escapefromtarkov.fandom.com/wiki. Interactive maps (MapGenie, Tarkov.Dev) may be used for confirmation.

RULES:
- If extract names appear in the screenshot, use those FIRST to identify the map.
- If confidence is very low (<25%), do NOT guess.
- No compass words. Only simple relative directions with landmarks.
- Use natural phrasing: "face X", "walk toward Y", "keep the fence on your right", "turn a bit left", etc.
- Always check if an extract requires an item/key. If it does, warn the player and also give a route to the nearest free extract.
- Keep steps short (2–3 steps).

Output (when confident):
**Map:** <Map>
**Approximate position:** <Short line>
**Nearest named location:** <POI or Unknown>
**Visible landmarks:** <1–3 clear objects>
**Nearby extracts:** <List extracts; mark ANY that require item/key>
**Best extract (free):** <Name of extract requiring no items, if available>
**Route (relative):**
- Step 1: <Face <landmark>. Walk toward it until <new landmark> appears.>
- Step 2: <With the <wall/fence/building> on your left/right, follow it until <final landmark>.>
- Step 3: <<Extract> will be just ahead/left/right when you get there.>

If the closest extract requires an item/key:
"<Extract> needs <item/key>. If you don't have it, use <FreeExtract> instead."

Output (low confidence):
"I can't identify your position from this screenshot. Try capturing a more recognizable area."
